bullets.text: Apple posts record sales and profit on strong iPhone and services; guides robust December quarter.
Amazon profit jumps 38%; boosts spending forecast to $125B as AWS sales grow 20%.
Alphabet shares rise 4% on strong earnings despite higher AI spend; Meta drops 11% as investors balk at escalating AI investments.
Netflix announces 10-for-1 stock split, aiming to increase liquidity and retail accessibility.
Reddit beats revenue and earnings forecasts on search and global expansion; shares jump on strong outlook.
Mortgage rates unexpectedly rose ~20 bps after the Fed cut; markets remain volatile as growth slows and inflation eases.
Government shutdown has cost contractors $12B; airlines warn of November travel ‘disaster’ and urge Congress to pay air traffic controllers.
Trump–Xi truce eases tariff and rare earth tensions; national security controls loom; shipping skeptical; Japan stocks hit records on improved sentiment.
Trump’s call to resume U.S. nuclear testing revives Cold War-era debates, with implications for arms control and Nevada test readiness.
Hurricane Melissa likely triggers Jamaica’s $150M catastrophe bond, providing rapid rebuilding funds and validating disaster-finance strategy.
Space becomes strategic arena: SpaceX and Blue Origin propose accelerating lunar missions as investors eye defense-space plays amid U.S.–China rivalry.
Nvidia reportedly investing up to $1B in AI startup Poolside, underscoring ongoing capital flows into foundational model tooling.
Scientists convert a common semiconductor into a superconductor, hinting at scalable pathways to superconducting electronics.
Nanotechnology reverses Alzheimer’s symptoms in mice, offering a potential therapeutic avenue pending human trials.
U.S. declines to sign UN cybercrime treaty, signaling divergence on digital governance and surveillance norms.
